intro: Aragallus campestris var. caeruleus, commonly known as the blue aragallus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and delicate, fern-like leaves that are often tinged with a bluish hue. The plant produces small, clustered umbels of white or pale blue flowers, which bloom in early summer. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
